channel.title: Changkhui: Indies' Kitchen
channel.itunes:subtitle: Culinary Crusine
channel.itunes:author: Kanjana Hongsyok
channel.itunes:summary: General discussion about culinary art, food science of the world
channel.description: General discussion about culinary art, food science of the world.

item.title: Indies' Girl Variety: 5. Chiangmai Night Market 4
item.itunes:author: Kanjana Hongsyok
item.itunes:subtitle: Guzzie and Kanjana
item.itunes:summary: Finally, Guzzie and Indies' Girl managed to conclude their market trip. Midnight, to be precise. For the last leg of their journey, they visited the fruits section. Hope you all enjoy their clips.
item.itunes:keywords: Thai Podcast, Thai, Food, Books

item.title: Indies' Girl Variety: 4. Chiangmai Night Market 3
item.itunes:author: Kanjana Hongsyok
item.itunes:subtitle: Guzzie and Kanjana
item.itunes:summary: Chiangmai Night market must be one of the largest markets in the world, since Guzzie and Indies Girl still could not finish their market walk. You could tell that they did enjoy their walk by the conversation tone. Anyway, it was always fun to see good story tellers.
item.itunes:keywords: Thai Podcast, Thai, Food, Books

item.title: Indies' Girl Variety: 3. Chiangmai Night Market 2
item.itunes:author: Kanjana Hongsyok
item.itunes:subtitle: Guzzie and Kanjana
item.itunes:summary: Guzzie and Indies Girl were continued their walk along night market in Chiangmai. Both thoroughly enjoyed the walk, buying a few things here and there. Evidently, the vegetables prices in Chiangmai were much lower than in Bangkok.
item.itunes:keywords: Thai Podcast, Thai, Food, Books

item.title: Indies' Girl Variety: 2. Chiangmai Night Market
item.itunes:author: Kanjana Hongsyok
item.itunes:subtitle: Guzzie and Kanjana
item.itunes:summary: Guzzie and Indies Girl were back and still in Chiangmai. They were just about to show you the night market there.
item.itunes:keywords: Thai Podcast, Thai, Food, Books

item.title: Indies' Girl Variety: 1. Around Chiangmai
item.itunes:author: Kanjana Hongsyok
item.itunes:subtitle: Guzzie and Kanjana
item.itunes:summary: We renamed the program to this so as to pass on the Indies' Kitchen name to the restaurant. Our Indies' Girl teamed up with Guzzie to talk to a guest, who was a local in Chiangmai, Benjamas Nimmanhaemin or Waew. She told us about what to see in Chiangmai.
item.itunes:keywords: Thai Podcast, Thai, Food, Books

item.title: Indies Kitchen 21: Cigar
item.itunes:author: Kanjana Hongsyok
item.itunes:subtitle: Castro and Kanjana on Cigar
item.itunes:summary: For the record, Kanjana antied smoking, but the topic was interesting enough. We had a visitor who used to enjoy a lot of smoking, but no longer consumed as much. So we asked if he could share his experience, what was so good about it, type and how to consume it properly. So from time to time, Indies' Girl may have a surprise for you.
item.itunes:keywords: Thai Podcast, Thai, Food, Books

item.title: Indies Kitchen 20: Favourite Books
item.itunes:author: Kanjana Hongsyok
item.itunes:subtitle: Indies' Girl showed her favourite food-related books.
item.itunes:summary: Sorry for audio listeners, this podcast was best viewed in VDO, which you could see it on our site, http://www.changkhui.com/Thai_IndiesKitchen.html. On this podcast, Gan from Mai Hlap Mai Non joined Indies' Girl to discuss her favourite food-related books. There were quite a few, but sorry, if our hosts forgot to mention the books titles and authors.
item.itunes:keywords: Thai Podcast, Thai, Food, Books

item.title: Indies Kitchen 19: Martha Stewart by Guzzie
item.itunes:author: Kanjana Hongsyok
item.itunes:subtitle: Guzzie, YaDa and Indies' Girl discussed about Martha Stewart.
item.itunes:summary: Guzzie took us across the Atlantic, from UK, to USA, This time to introduce us to Martha Stewart. We also had Ya Da as our guest. It was interesting to see that the two ladies had a lot of things in common, apart from being born on the same year. Their life cycles hit their up's and down's at surprisingly the same time. Photo were provided on courtesy of Amazon.com (http://www.amazon.com). The official site of Martha Stewart is at http://www.marthastewart.com.
item.itunes:keywords: Thai Podcast, Thai, Food, Martha Stewart

item.title: Indies Kitchen 18: Tasting and Testing as a profession by Dr.Thongchai
item.itunes:author: Kanjana Hongsyok
item.itunes:subtitle: KU has a center for Tasting and Testing
item.itunes:summary: It's generally known in international markets that food tasting can be a profession, but it was rare to see one in this country. Therefore, it was a surprise that Kasetsart university had a course especially for this task. Dr.Thongchai gave us an overview about what KU had to offer, and also, an opening for a part-time for product testing. Mind you, it was not alwasy about food tasting.
item.itunes:keywords: Thai Podcast, Thai Food, Thai, Food, Kasetsart University

item.title: Indies Kitchen 17: Delia Smith by Guzzie
item.itunes:author: Kanjana Hongsyok
item.itunes:subtitle: An intro to Delia Smith
item.itunes:summary: Guzzie revisited Indies' Kitchen, along with a special guest, YaDa. They discusssed about an Icon in the international crusine industry, Delia Smith. The lady was a role model for Guzzie, whose first cooking book was Delia Smith's. Delia was so famous in the UK that the Rolling Stones used her cooking as the cover for the album Let It Bleed. You can also check for more info at http://www.deliaonline.com. Thank you Guzzie very much for her courtesy in preparing the materials for this episode.
item.itunes:keywords: Thai Podcast, Thai Food, Thai, Food, Delia Smith

item.title: Indies Kitchen 16: Chef Ban from Wai-Thai Restaurant
item.itunes:author: Kanjana Hongsyok
item.itunes:subtitle: How he became a chef
item.itunes:summary: Back to the restaurant, as usual, Indies' Girl talked to the chef. The guy was really an unlikely chef due to his unintended effort. The restaurant address is http://www.wai-thai.com.
item.itunes:keywords: Thai Podcast, Thai Food, Thai, Food, Heath Food

item.title: Indies Kitchen 15: Hommali Flour
item.itunes:author: Kanjana Hongsyok
item.itunes:subtitle: Ass.Prof. Penkwan Chompreeda explained what it was used for.
item.itunes:summary: Indies' Girl talked to Associate Professor Penkwan Chompreeda about a made-in-Thailand product, Hommali flour. The product was made from Jasmine rice as a project initiated by the then-dean of Kasetsart university, the flour could be used as a replacement for wheat flour. If you were interested, you could see it the flour and what it can be used for (depened on when you actually read this) at the Kaset Fair, Kasetsart university Jan. 26 - Feb. 3, 2007.
item.itunes:keywords: Thai Podcast, Thai Food, Thai, Food, Heath Food, flour

item.title: Indies Kitchen 14: Wai-Thai
item.itunes:author: Kanjana Hongsyok
item.itunes:subtitle: A Thai restaurant, focusing on health food on Silom road
item.itunes:summary: A new style of Thai food, which aims to go international. Indies'Girl interviewed khun Paralee, the manager, about how this was started. It's interesting how you can operate a restaurant without using cooking oil, sugar and MSG, and this is located in Silom. Even better, they operate in an open-kitchen environment. The restaurant address is http://www.wai-thai.com.
item.itunes:keywords: Thai Podcast, Thai Food, Thai, Food, Heath Food

item.title: Indies Kitchen 13: Visiting Ta Phra Arthit
item.itunes:author: Kanjana Hongsyok
item.itunes:subtitle: The program first VDO clip
item.itunes:summary: The program was demo for TV program. It did not make the cut and the project was dropped. However, since the material was not so bad, we decided to put it here and let you see. This time Indies' Girl took you to an local, cheap-but-good indian restaurant at Tah Phra Arthit, hear Thammasart University.
item.itunes:keywords: Thai Podcast, Thai Food, Thai, Food

item.title: Indies Kitchen 12: Eat-out at Klongton
item.itunes:author: Kanjana Hongsyok
item.itunes:subtitle: Indies' Girl, Ood and Gan (Mai Hlap Mai Non) talked about various eating places in the area
item.itunes:summary: Indies' Girl asked Ood for his suggestion on various eating places around his living area. Of cource, true to his style, these places were not expensive. And, at the end of the discussion, Gan joined in with her suggestion.
item.itunes:keywords: Thai Podcast, Thai Food, Thai, Food

item.title: Indies Kitchen 11: Eat-out at Town-in-Town
item.itunes:author: Kanjana Hongsyok
item.itunes:subtitle: Indies' Girl and Gan (Mai Hlap Mai Non) talked about various eating places in the area
item.itunes:summary: Indies' Girl and Gan talked about where to eat in Town-in-Town area. Gan, having lived there for the last six years, offered her personal opinion about the shops in the area.
item.itunes:keywords: Thai Podcast, Thai Food, Thai, Food

item.title: Indies Kitchen 10: Instant Coffee
item.itunes:author: Kanjana Hongsyok
item.itunes:subtitle: Coffee drinkers sat down and discussed their favourite instant coffee.
item.itunes:summary: Indies' Girl invited friends in the Changkhui circle to exchanged their coffee drinking habits. She focused mainly on the instant coffee. The latter part of the show was an interview with an expert in the Thai instant coffee industry about how to produce it and why it became sour after a certain period of time.
item.itunes:keywords: Thai Podcast, coffee, Thai Food, Thai, instant coffee

item.title: Indies Kitchen 9: Kratong Expert and his UK experience
item.itunes:author: Kanjana Hongsyok
item.itunes:subtitle: Interviewed Rathasilp Kraiperm
item.itunes:summary: Indies' Girl met another overseas experience chef. However, this guy also had a crafting skills with some experience in Thailand. He spent 7 months in UK with horrible experience. But, at the time of this writing, he was back in Bangkok, and was competitive in Loi Kratong festival, he had won several awards for his Kratong decoration.
item.itunes:keywords: Thai Podcast, Fodd Craft, Thai Food, Thai

item.title: Indies Kitchen 8: Caution note About Food Packaging
item.itunes:author: Kanjana Hongsyok
item.itunes:subtitle: Interviewed Dr.Panuwat
item.itunes:summary: Kanjana visited Kasetsart university to visit Dr. Panuwat. He explained into great length about what most people were not aware of, in daily use of food packaging and wrapping. It was quite shocking what we did everyday and were not aware of the danger.
item.itunes:keywords: Thai Podcast, Food Packaging, Food Wrapping

item.title: Indies Kitchen 7: Running Restaurants
item.itunes:author: Kanjana Hongsyok
item.itunes:subtitle: Interviewed Dawadee
item.itunes:summary: Dawadee received an MBA from an American university during mid90s, and, instead of coming home, she decided to serve in a restaurant and ended up running one in Chicago as a hired manager. The story should remind some Thai folks who waited during their times overseas. She is running now in Bangkok, and you may contact her for her service.
item.itunes:keywords: Cooking, Thai Food, Restaurants, Thai Podcast

item.title: Indies Kitchen 6: Food Stylist
item.itunes:author: Kanjana Hongsyok
item.itunes:subtitle: Interviewed Chonlada Ananaweenusorn
item.itunes:summary: It is not just the job for photographers, those beatiful pictures on magazine cover are results of collaborations of, at least, photographers and stylists. On this episode, Indies Girl interviewed a professional "Food Stylist" khun Chonlada Ananaweenusorn. She shared her story about what her work was like and tips and tricks of producing great food photos.
item.itunes:keywords: Cooking, Thai Food, Pantip.com, Thai Podcast, Photos, Photo

item.title: Indies Kitchen 5: Triny of Pantip.com
item.itunes:author: Kanjana Hongsyok
item.itunes:subtitle: Triny of Food section, Pantip.com
item.itunes:summary: Another Internet celebrity in Pantip.com gave us an interview, TRINY. She was a cute lady with a talent for cooking and sharing her knowledge about it. She even owned a restaurant named, Krua Mae Min. Listen to her story how she learnt cooking and joined the cyberspace.
item.itunes:keywords: Cooking, Thai Food, Pantip.com, Thai Podcast

item.title: Indies Kitchen 4: Guzzie of Pantip.com
item.itunes:author: Kanjana Hongsyok
item.itunes:subtitle: Guzzie of Food section, Pantip.com
item.itunes:summary: Indies' Girl introduced us to two well-known Net-personalities in Pantip.com of Thailand. They were known for their generosity in sharing their knowledge in Thai culinary arts, making countless contributions in answering questions about Thai food. Our first guest was Guzzie, a veteran in the Thai Internet community, well, she even used to use IRC (could anyone remember?). She was gracious in both her writing and talking styles.
item.itunes:keywords: Chef, Thai Food, Pantip.com, Thai Podcast

item.title: a chef's life, part 4
item.itunes:author: Kanjana Hongsyok
item.itunes:subtitle: Kanjana Hongsyok interviewed a professional chef, Vee Wongsuntivanich, continued
item.itunes:summary: Finally, Kanjana managed to finish the interview. In this tape, Vee mainly explained about what he was doing at the time of the interview, being in a team, responsible for the food section of the biggest shopping mall in the country. The attention of details of his new company was certainly a new experience to him, they did indeed count everything in dollar and cent. We sincerely thank Vee for sharing his time with us.
item.itunes:keywords: Chef, Thai Food, Apprenticeship, Thai Podcast

item.title: a chef's life, part 3
item.itunes:author: Kanjana Hongsyok
item.itunes:subtitle: Kanjana Hongsyok interviewed a professional chef, Vee Wongsuntivanich, continued
item.itunes:summary: A luxury restaurant in Thailand was a nice change, and he did enjoy the experience there. However, this guy enjoyed moving around. He received another offer to another restaurant in UK. This time, things ain't fun anymore, commuting became a big ordeal and a chef was fired.
item.itunes:keywords: Chef, Thai Food, Apprenticeship, Thai Podcast

item.title: a chef's life, part 2
item.itunes:author: Kanjana Hongsyok
item.itunes:subtitle: Kanjana Hongsyok interviewed a professional chef, Vee Wongsuntivanich, continued
item.itunes:summary: Vee shared his experience, how he many rejections he received during his early years, his overseas apprenticeship and how he fought his way up. The story was long and we had to cut into parts, continued
item.itunes:keywords: Chef, Thai Food, Apprenticeship, Thai Podcast

item.title: a chef's life
item.itunes:author: Kanjana Hongsyok
item.itunes:subtitle: Kanjana Hongsyok interviewed a professional chef, Vee Wongsuntivanich
item.itunes:summary: Vee shared his experience, how he many rejections he received during his early years, his overseas apprenticeship and how he fought his way up. The story was long and we had to cut into parts.
item.itunes:keywords: Chef, Thai Food, Apprenticeship, Thai Podcast

item.title: R & D insider
item.itunes:author: Kanjana Hongsyok
item.itunes:subtitle: Kanjana Hongsyok interviewed a lab specialist, k.Kannika Thongupakan
item.itunes:summary: How does R&D work in this country? Is it a cost center or a profit center? We talk to K.Kannika Thongupakan, R&D specialist (having been through both human and animal foods). She shared her personal experience, having worked in some internationl firms in the country.
item.itunes:keywords: Food Science, Lab, R&D

item.title: PH.D in Food Science 1 of 3
item.itunes:author: Kanjana Hongsyok
item.itunes:subtitle: Kanjana Hongsyok interviewed Dr.Walairat of Kasetsart University
item.itunes:summary: Our host, Kanjana, managed to interview Dr.Walairat Jantarapanonda. She had a Ph.D in food science from USA and is currently teaching at Kasetsart University. She talked about how she got interested in the field and the current development in the industry. This is a pretty long interview, so she taped them into three files for easy downloads. How thoughtful
item.itunes:keywords: Food Science, Culinary, Kasetsart

item.title: PH.D in Food Science 2 of 3
item.itunes:author: Kanjana Hongsyok
item.itunes:subtitle: Kanjana Hongsyok interviewed Dr.Walairat of Kasetsart University
item.itunes:summary: Our host, Kanjana, managed to interview Dr.Walairat Jantarapanonda. She had a Ph.D in food science from USA and is currently teaching at Kasetsart University. She talked about how she got interested in the field and the current development in the industry. This is a pretty long interview, so she taped them into three files for easy downloads. How thoughtful
item.itunes:keywords: Food Science, Culinary, Kasetsart

item.itunes:author: Kanjana Hongsyok
item.itunes:subtitle: Kanjana Hongsyok interviewed Dr.Walairat of Kasetsart University
item.itunes:summary: Our host, Kanjana, managed to interview Dr.Walairat Jantarapanonda. She had a Ph.D in food science from USA and is currently teaching at Kasetsart University. She talked about how she got interested in the field and the current development in the industry. This is a pretty long interview, so she taped them into three files for easy downloads.
